page.title: 07ENERGY IN THE CLUNTON AREA
page.content: COAL. Many people still use open coal fires for warmth. GAS. There is no mains gas available but Calor Gas in sealed containers for cooking is delivered from agencies in Craven Arms or collected from a depot in the old railway station yard at Broome. ELECTRICITY. The area is connected to the national grid. OIL. Most systems of central heating are oil based. WOOD. A great deal of wood is burned on open fires and in wood burning stoves. Some is gleaned from dead trees and prunings and some offcuts from the Forestry Commission or wood from local merchants. WATER. Clunton is now connected to the mains system but there is a tap outside the old schoolroom which is spring water.
